title: Tourist Submersible Vessel Vanishes on Its Way to Titanic Wreckage
description: A spokesman for the U.S. Coast Guard said the five people on the submersible theoretically had 70 to 96 hours of oxygen before the situation became dire.

title: Greece Migrant Drowning Questions
description: Contradictions in the Coast Guard’s account cast new doubts over how the Greeks handled one of the worst maritime disasters in the country’s history.

title: Tropical Storm Bret Forms in the Atlantic
description: The storm formed Monday east of the Windward Islands, the National Hurricane Center said. It is forecast to strengthen into a hurricane by the end of the week.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Xi and Blinken Meet
description: Also, New Zealand slipped into a recession.

title: In Lviv, Ukraine, Digging Up Old Graves to Bury Newly Fallen Soldiers
description: Funerals have taken on a grim routine in the Ukrainian city of Lviv, and as the fighting grows more intense during the counteroffensive, gravediggers say they are bracing for more bodies.

title: Pakistan Declares Day of Mourning for Migrant Ship Disaster
description: Officials say more than 100 Pakistanis were among those killed when a fishing boat overloaded with migrants capsized in deep Mediterranean waters. The toll is expected to rise.

title: Tourist Vessel Disappears in Area of Titanic Wreck
description: A search-and-rescue mission is underway in the North Atlantic for the missing craft, the Coast Guard said. It is unclear how many people were on board.

title: Titanic Tourist Submarine Goes Missing in the North Atlantic
description: A search-and-rescue mission was underway after the craft went missing in the North Atlantic, the Coast Guard said. It was unclear how many people were on board.

title: Uruguay’s President Halts Plan to Turn Bronze Nazi Eagle Into Peace Dove
description: President Luis Lacalle Pou said that he was canceling a project to melt down and recast a 700-pound relic of World War II after thousands signed a petition calling for it to be preserved in a museum.

title: U.S. Worries About Private Chinese Companies Aiding Russia, Blinken Says
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he urged Chinese officials “to be vigilant” as Washington continues to express concerns over possible military support to Russia.

title: Ahead of Expo 2030 Bid, Rome Dreams of Reinvigoration
description: After years of decline, the city hopes to use a bid for the next world’s fair to re-envision itself as a place that works.

title: Boris Johnson Faces New Indignity as He Awaits Vote in U.K. Parliament
description: The former prime minister may lose his pass to Parliament, another stinging blow from the fallout of lockdown-breaking parties during the pandemic.

title: At Least 4 Palestinians Killed as Israel Deploys Helicopter in West Bank
description: A 15-year-old boy was among the dead and dozens more were wounded, according to Palestinian officials, in fighting after an Israeli raid. Seven Israeli soldiers were also hurt, the military said.

title: Ukraine Confirms Another Small Gain in the South
description: Ukraine said that it had recaptured a total of eight settlements over two weeks of “offensive actions.”

title: Once Scorned, Far Right Secures Foothold in Spanish Cities
description: Local alliances between the center-right Popular Party and the far-right Vox may foreshadow a broader coalition agreement at the national level.

title: New Trial of Russia’s Jailed Opposition Leader Navalny Begins
description: If convicted, the charges could add decades to the prison terms that the jailed opposition leader is already serving.

title: The Racial Wage Gap Is Shrinking
description: Though still enormous, the gap has shrunk over the past five years.

title: The Racial Wage Gap Is Shrinking
description: Though still enormous, the gap has shrunk over the past five years.

title: Germany and China Try to Reset Relations for a Changed World
description: This week the two countries will restart government consultations after a pandemic hiatus, but amid the war in Ukraine and rising U.S., Chinese tensions, common ground may be elusive.

title: Should Medicine Still Bother With Eponyms?
description: The names of Nazi-era doctors are still found on diseases and body parts. By expunging them, will doctors forget lessons of the past?

title: In Argentina, Inflation Passes 100% (and the Restaurants Are Packed)
description: Argentina’s financial crisis has a surprising side effect: a flourishing dining scene in Buenos Aires, as residents rush to spend pesos before they lose more value.

title: Russia Sought to Assassinate an Informant in the U.S.
description: A failed plot to assassinate a C.I.A. spy in 2020 in part led to expulsions of the agency’s chief in Moscow and his Russian counterpart in Washington.

title: In Rush to Arm Ukraine, Weapons Are Bought but Not Delivered, or Too Broken to Use
description: Some of the weapons sent to Ukraine by other countries have been unusable, and hundreds of millions of dollars in contracts paid up front have yet to be fulfilled.

title: Ukraine retakes some villages but its forces face minefields and more airstrikes.
Your Monday Briefing
description: Shifts in global economic policy.

title: In China, Blinken Holds ‘Candid’ Talks to Restart High-Level Diplomacy
description: The talks between Antony J. Blinken, the secretary of state, and Wang Yi, Beijing’s top foreign policy official, were a prelude to an expected meeting with China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

title: ​North Korea Criticizes Officials for Failed Satellite Launch​
description: Top political leaders said the botched May 31 launch, which was meant to put a military spy satellite in orbit, had been “irresponsibly” planned.
